<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">THE GOLDMAN SACHS
    GROUP, INC. and SUBSIDIARIES<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Geographic
    Information</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Due to the highly integrated nature of international financial
    markets, the firm manages its businesses based on the
    profitability of the enterprise as a whole. Since a significant
    portion of the firm&#146;s activities require cross-border
    coordination in order to facilitate the needs of the firm&#146;s
    clients, the methodology for allocating the firm&#146;s
    profitability to geographic regions is dependent on the judgment
    of management.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Geographic results are generally allocated as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Investment Banking: location of the client and investment
    banking team.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Fixed Income, Currency and Commodities, and Equities: location
    of the trading desk.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Principal Investments: location of the investment.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Asset Management: location of the sales team.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Securities Services: location of the primary market for the
    underlying security.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    pre-tax earnings of the firm and its consolidated subsidiaries
    by geographic region allocated on the methodology described
    above, as well as the percentage of total net revenues and total

&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 5%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=456 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)</FONT></SUP></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Substantially all relates to U.S.
    results.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)</FONT></SUP></TD>

    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">EMEA (Europe, Middle East and
    Africa).
    </FONT></TD>

    number of litigation and regulatory proceedings.
    </FONT></TD>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='326'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">SUPPLEMENTAL
    FINANCIAL INFORMATION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <A name='327'><B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Quarterly
    Results (unaudited)</FONT></B></A>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following represents the firm&#146;s unaudited quarterly
    results for 2007 and 2006. These quarterly results were prepared
    in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and
    reflect all adjustments that are, in the opinion of management,
    necessary for a fair statement of the results. These adjustments
    are of a normal recurring nature.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 0%">

    On January&#160;18, 2008, the last reported sales price for the
    firm&#146;s common stock on the New York Stock Exchange was
    $187.21 per share.

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">SUPPLEMENTAL
    FINANCIAL INFORMATION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<A name='329'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Selected
    Financial Data</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Item&#160;9.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='126'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Changes
    in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and
    Financial Disclosure</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    There were no changes in or disagreements with accountants on
    accounting and financial disclosure during the last two fiscal
    years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Item&#160;9A.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='127'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Controls
    and Procedures</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of the end of the period covered by this report, an
    evaluation was carried out by Goldman Sachs&#146; management,
    with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer and Chief
    Financial Officer, of the effectiveness of our disclosure
    controls and procedures (as defined in
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Rule&#160;13a-15(e)</FONT>
    under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934). Based upon that
    evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial
    Officer concluded that these disclosure controls and procedures
    were effective as of the end of the period covered by this
    report. In addition, no change in our internal control over
    financial reporting (as defined in
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Rule&#160;13a-15(f)</FONT>
    under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934)&#160;occurred during
    the fourth quarter of our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2007 that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
    materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial
    Reporting and the Report of Independent Registered Public
    Accounting Firm are set forth in Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of
    the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Item&#160;9B.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='128'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Other
    Information</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Not applicable.
</DIV>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='129'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PART&#160;III</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Item&#160;10.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='130'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Directors,
    Executive Officers and Corporate Governance</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Information relating to our executive officers is included on
    pages&#160;42 to 43 of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K.</FONT>
    Information relating to our directors, including our audit
    committee and audit committee financial experts and the
    procedures by which shareholders can recommend director
    nominees, and our executive officers will be in our definitive
    Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to
    be held on April&#160;10, 2008, which will be filed within
    120&#160;days of the end of our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2007 (the 2008 Proxy Statement) and is
    incorporated herein by reference. Information relating to our
    Code of Business Conduct and Ethics that applies to our senior
    financial officers, as defined in the Code, is included in
    Part&#160;I, Item&#160;1 of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    Information relating to our executive officer and director
    compensation will be in the 2008 Proxy Statement and is
    incorporated herein by reference.

    The following table provides information generally as of
    November&#160;30, 2007, the last day of fiscal 2007 (but taking
    into consideration equity-based awards granted on
    December&#160;19, 2007 in respect of fiscal 2007 performance or
    as part of the firm&#146;s Discount Stock Program), regarding
    securities to be issued on exercise of stock options, and
    securities remaining available for issuance under our equity
    compensation plans that were in effect during fiscal 2007.

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP>&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The Goldman Sachs Amended and Restated Stock Incentive Plan (the
    SIP) was approved by the shareholders of Goldman Sachs at our
    2003 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is a successor plan to
    The Goldman Sachs 1999 Stock Incentive Plan (the 1999 Plan),
    which was approved by our shareholders immediately prior to our
    initial public offering in May 1999 and under which no
    additional awards have been granted since approval of the SIP.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(2)</SUP>&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Includes options that are subject to vesting and other
    conditions.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(3)</SUP>&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Of these shares, 72,092,339&#160;shares may be issued pursuant
    to outstanding restricted stock units, including
    71,982,173&#160;shares granted under the SIP and
    110,166&#160;shares granted under the 1999 Plan;
    268,404&#160;shares may be issued pursuant to outstanding
    performance-based units granted under the SIP.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(4)</SUP>&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Represents shares remaining to be issued under the SIP
    (227,341,869&#160;shares) and the 1999 Plan
    (110,166&#160;shares). The total number of shares of common
    stock that may be delivered pursuant to awards granted under the
    SIP initially may not exceed 250,000,000&#160;shares. Beginning
    November&#160;29, 2008 and each fiscal year thereafter, the
    number of shares of common stock that may be delivered pursuant
    to awards granted after April&#160;1, 2003 under the SIP may not
    exceed 5% of our issued and outstanding shares of common stock,
    determined as of the last day of the immediately preceding
    fiscal year, increased by the number of shares that were
    available for awards in previous fiscal years but were not, at
    the date of determination, covered by awards granted in previous
    years.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

    <TD>
    <A name='134'></A><B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Principal
    Accountant Fees and Services</FONT></B>
</TD>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Information regarding principal accountant fees and services
    will be in the 2008 Proxy Statement and is incorporated herein
    by reference.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Cash payments for third-party interest, net of capitalized
    interest, were $7.78&#160;billion, $6.11&#160;billion and
    $3.69&#160;billion for the years ended November 2007, November
    2006 and November 2005, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Cash payments for income taxes, net of refunds, were
    $3.27&#160;billion, $2.86&#160;billion and $1.52&#160;billion
    for the years ended November 2007, November 2006 and November
    2005, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The accompanying notes are an integral part of these condensed
    nonconsolidated financial statements.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-4
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="right" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">SCHEDULE
    I</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">THE GOLDMAN SACHS
    GROUP, INC.<BR>
    (PARENT COMPANY ONLY)<BR>
    <BR>
    <A name='336'>NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Note&#160;1.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Significant
    Accounting Policies</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Basis of
    Presentation </FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The condensed nonconsolidated financial statements of The
    Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (the parent company), a Delaware
    corporation, should be read in conjunction with the consolidated
    financial statements of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. and
    subsidiaries (the firm) and notes thereto (the consolidated
    financial statements), which are included in Part&#160;II,
    Item&#160;8 of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K.</FONT>
    These condensed nonconsolidated financial statements reflect the
    results of operations, financial condition and cash flows for
    the parent company only. Investments in subsidiaries are
    accounted for using the equity method of accounting prescribed
    by Accounting Principles Board (APB) Opinion No.&#160;18,
    &#147;The Equity Method of Accounting for Investments in Common
    Stock.&#148; For investments, other than investments in
    subsidiaries, acquired subsequent to the firm&#146;s adoption of
    Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS) No.&#160;159,
    &#147;The Fair Value Option for Financial Assets and Financial
    Liabilities,&#148; at the beginning of 2007, the parent company
    generally has elected to apply the fair value option in
    accounting for such investments. See Notes&#160;2 and 3 to the
    consolidated financial statements in Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8
    of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for information regarding the firm&#146;s accounting under
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;159.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Unless otherwise stated herein, all references to November 2007,
    November 2006 and November 2005 refer to the parent
    company&#146;s fiscal years ended, or the dates, as the context
    requires, November&#160;30, 2007, November&#160;24, 2006 and
    November&#160;25, 2005, respectively. Certain reclassifications
    have been made to previously reported amounts to conform to the
    current presentation.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The parent company&#146;s significant accounting policies are
    identical to those used by the firm, to the extent applicable to
    the parent company&#146;s activities. For further information
    regarding the firm&#146;s significant accounting policies, refer
    to Note&#160;2 to the consolidated financial statements in
    Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Use of
    Estimates</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    These condensed nonconsolidated financial statements have been
    prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting
    principles that require management to make certain estimates and
    assumptions. The most important of these estimates and
    assumptions relate to fair value measurements, the accounting
    for goodwill and identifiable intangible assets and the
    provision for potential losses that may arise from litigation
    and regulatory proceedings and tax audits. Although these and
    other estimates and assumptions are based on the best available
    information, actual results could be materially different from
    these estimates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Financing of
    Subsidiaries</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Substantially all of the firm&#146;s unsecured funding is raised
    by the parent company. The parent company then lends the
    necessary funds to its subsidiaries, some of which are
    regulated, to meet their asset financing and capital
    requirements. In addition, the parent company provides its
    regulated subsidiaries with the necessary capital to meet their
    regulatory requirements. Such funding is included in &#147;Loans
    to subsidiaries&#148; and &#147;Subordinated loans to
    subsidiaries&#148; in the condensed nonconsolidated statements
    of financial condition. Intercompany exposure is managed by
    requiring senior and subordinated intercompany loans to have
    maturities equal to or shorter than the maturities of the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-5
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">THE GOLDMAN SACHS
    GROUP, INC.<BR>
    (PARENT COMPANY ONLY)<BR>
    <BR>
    NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    aggregate borrowings of the parent company. This policy ensures
    that the subsidiaries&#146; obligations to the parent company
    will generally mature in advance of the parent company&#146;s
    third-party borrowings. In addition, many of the subsidiaries
    pledge collateral at loan value to cover their intercompany
    borrowings (other than subordinated debt) in order to mitigate
    parent company liquidity risk. Equity investments in
    subsidiaries are generally funded with equity capital and
    included in &#147;Investments in subsidiaries&#148; in the
    condensed nonconsolidated statements of financial condition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The parent company enters into derivative contracts with
    subsidiaries to hedge its net investment in
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.&#160;operations</FONT>
    and to manage the interest rate and currency exposure on its
    unsecured
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
    borrowings and certain unsecured short-term borrowings. To
    manage exposure on its borrowings, the parent company uses
    derivatives to effectively convert a substantial portion of its
    unsecured long-term borrowings into U.S.&#160;dollar-based
    floating rate obligations. The parent company applies fair value
    hedge accounting to derivative contracts that hedge the
    benchmark interest rate (i.e., London Interbank Offered Rate
    (LIBOR)) on its fixed rate unsecured long-term borrowings.
    Derivative balances with subsidiaries, included in
    &#147;Financial instruments owned, at fair value&#148; and
    &#147;Financial instruments sold, but not yet purchased, at fair
    value&#148; in the condensed nonconsolidated statements of
    financial condition, were $15.10&#160;billion and
    $620&#160;million, and $6.16&#160;billion and $347&#160;million,
    as of November 2007 and November 2006, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Interest income is largely generated from loans made to
    subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The parent company also allocates substantially all rental and
    other costs relating to properties occupied by certain
    subsidiaries. The parent company additionally allocates the cost
    of share-based compensation programs to subsidiaries relating to
    costs associated with employees of those subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Note&#160;2.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Unsecured
    Short-Term Borrowings</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The parent company obtains third-party unsecured short-term
    borrowings primarily through the issuance of promissory notes,
    commercial paper and hybrid financial instruments. As of
    November&#160;2007 and November 2006, these borrowings were
    $46.58&#160;billion and $32.63&#160;billion, respectively. Such
    amounts include the portion of third-party unsecured long-term
    borrowings maturing within one year of the financial statement
    date and third-party unsecured long-term borrowings that are
    redeemable within one year of the financial statement date at
    the option of the holder. The parent company accounts for
    promissory notes, commercial paper and certain hybrid financial
    instruments at fair value under SFAS&#160;No.&#160;155,
    &#147;Accounting for Certain Hybrid Financial
    Instruments&#160;&#151; an amendment of FASB statements
    No.&#160;133 and 140,&#148; or SFAS&#160;No.&#160;159. See
    Notes&#160;2 and 3 to the consolidated financial statements in
    Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for information regarding the firm&#146;s accounting under
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;155 and SFAS&#160;No.&#160;159. Third-party
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">short-term</FONT>
    borrowings that are not recorded at fair value are recorded
    based on the amount of cash received plus accrued interest, and
    such amounts approximate fair value due to the short-term nature
    of the obligations.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-6
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">THE GOLDMAN SACHS
    GROUP, INC.<BR>
    (PARENT COMPANY ONLY)<BR>
    <BR>
    NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Unsecured short-term borrowings with third parties are set forth
    below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 5%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=456 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP>&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The weighted average interest rates for these borrowings, after
    giving effect to hedging activities, were 5.30% and 5.36% as of
    November 2007 and November 2006, respectively. The weighted
    average interest rates as of November 2007 and November 2006
    excluded financial instruments accounted for at fair value under
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;155 or SFAS&#160;No. 159.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In addition, the parent company may obtain unsecured short-term
    borrowings from certain subsidiaries. As of November 2007 and
    November 2006, such amounts were $5.14&#160;billion and
    $1.54&#160;billion, respectively, and included in
    &#147;Unsecured short-term borrowings&#160;&#151; With
    subsidiaries&#148; in the condensed nonconsolidated statements
    of financial condition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Note&#160;3.&#160;&#160;Unsecured
    Long-Term Borrowings</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The parent company&#146;s third-party unsecured long-term
    borrowings extend through 2043 and consist principally of senior
    borrowings. As of November 2007 and November 2006, these
    borrowings were $157.00&#160;billion and $119.04&#160;billion,
    respectively. The parent company accounts for certain of these
    unsecured long-term borrowings at fair value under
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;155 or SFAS&#160;No.&#160;159 and applies
    fair value hedge accounting to certain of these unsecured
    long-term borrowings under SFAS&#160;No.&#160;133,
    &#147;Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging
    Activities.&#148; See Notes&#160;2 and 3 to the consolidated
    financial statements in Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of the Annual
    Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for information regarding the firm&#146;s accounting under
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;133, SFAS&#160;No.&#160;155 and
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;159.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Unsecured long-term borrowings with third parties are set forth
    below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 0%">

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 5%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=456 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP>&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    As of November 2007 and November 2006, interest rates on U.S.
    dollar fixed rate obligations ranged from 3.88% to 10.04% and
    from 3.88% to 12.00%, respectively. As of both November 2007 and
    November 2006, interest rates on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.</FONT>
    dollar fixed rate obligations ranged from 0.67% to 8.88%.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(2)</SUP>&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Floating interest rates generally are based on LIBOR or the
    federal funds target rate. Equity-linked and indexed instruments
    are included in floating rate obligations.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)</FONT></SUP><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Unsecured long-term borrowings
    maturing within one year of the financial statement date and
    certain unsecured
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
    borrowings that are redeemable within one year of the financial
    statement date at the option of the holder are included as
    unsecured short-term borrowings in the condensed nonconsolidated
    statements of financial condition.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)</FONT></SUP><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Unsecured long-term borrowings that
    are repayable prior to maturity at the option of the parent
    company are reflected at their contractual maturity dates.
    Unsecured long-term borrowings that are redeemable prior to
    maturity at the option of the holder are reflected at the dates
    such options become exercisable.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The parent company enters into derivative contracts with
    subsidiaries, such as interest rate futures contracts, interest
    rate swap agreements, currency swap agreements, commodity
    contracts and equity-linked and indexed contracts, to
    effectively convert a substantial portion of its third-party
    unsecured long-term borrowings into U.S.&#160;dollar-based
    floating rate obligations. Accordingly, the carrying value of
    these unsecured long-term borrowings approximated fair value as
    of November 2007 and November 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The effective weighted average interest rates for unsecured
    long-term borrowings with third parties are set forth below:
</DIV>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)</FONT></SUP><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#160;

</TD>

    that have been converted into floating rate obligations through
    derivative contracts.
    </FONT>

    </FONT>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
    $
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
    3,275
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000">
&nbsp;

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 5%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)</FONT></SUP><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">As of November 2007 the interest
    rate on U.S. dollar fixed rate obligations was 4.68% and as of
    November 2006 ranged from 4.68% to 5.78%. As of November 2007
    the interest rate on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.</FONT>
    dollar fixed rate obligations was 6.00% and as of November 2006
    ranged from 5.44% to 6.00%.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)</FONT></SUP><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Floating interest rates generally
    are based on LIBOR or the federal funds target rate.
    Equity-linked and indexed instruments are included in floating
    rate obligations.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Unsecured long-term borrowings with subsidiaries by maturity
    date are set forth below:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 5%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    <SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top"><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)</FONT></SUP><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Unsecured long-term borrowings
    maturing within one year of the financial statement date and
    certain unsecured
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">long-term</FONT>
    borrowings that are redeemable within one year of the financial
    statement date at the option of the holder are included as
    unsecured short-term borrowings in the condensed nonconsolidated
    statements of financial condition.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Subordinated
    Borrowings</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Unsecured long-term borrowings with third parties include
    subordinated borrowings with outstanding principal amounts of
    $16.00&#160;billion and $7.34&#160;billion as of November 2007
    and November&#160;2006, respectively, as set forth below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Subordinated Notes.</B>&#160;&#160;As of November 2007, the
    parent company had $10.91&#160;billion of subordinated notes
    outstanding with maturities ranging from fiscal 2009 to 2037.
    The effective weighted average interest rate on these
    subordinated notes was 5.74%, after giving effect to derivative
    contracts used to convert fixed rate obligations into floating
    rate obligations. As of November 2006, the parent company had
    $4.50&#160;billion of subordinated notes outstanding with
    maturities ranging from 2008 to 2036 and with an effective
    weighted average interest rate of 5.45%. These notes are junior
    in right of payment to all of the parent company&#146;s senior
    indebtedness.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-9
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">THE GOLDMAN SACHS
    GROUP, INC.<BR>
    (PARENT COMPANY ONLY)<BR>
    <BR>
    NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Junior Subordinated Debt Issued to a Trust in Connection with
    Trust&#160;Preferred Securities.&#160;&#160;</B>The parent
    company issued $2.84&#160;billion of junior subordinated
    debentures in its first quarter of 2004 to Goldman Sachs Capital
    I (the Trust). Refer to Note&#160;5 to the consolidated
    financial statements in Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of the Annual
    Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for information on junior subordinated debentures issued by the
    parent company to the Trust.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Junior Subordinated Debt Issued to Trusts in Connection with
    Fixed-to-Floating and Floating Rate Normal Automatic Preferred
    Enhanced Capital Securities.</B>&#160;&#160;In the second
    quarter of 2007, the parent company issued a total of
    $2.25&#160;billion of remarketable junior subordinated notes to
    Goldman Sachs Capital&#160;II and Goldman Sachs Capital&#160;III
    (the Trusts). Refer to Note&#160;5 to the consolidated financial
    statements in Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for information on junior subordinated debentures issued by the
    parent company to the Trusts.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Note&#160;4.&#160;&#160;Commitments,
    Contingencies and Guarantees</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Commitments</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Letters of Credit.</B>&#160;&#160;The parent company provides
    letters of credit issued by various banks to counterparties in
    lieu of securities or cash to satisfy various collateral
    requirements. Letters of credit outstanding were
    $222&#160;million and $171&#160;million as of November 2007 and
    November 2006, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Investment Commitments.</B>&#160;&#160;In connection with the
    firm&#146;s merchant banking and other investing activities, the
    parent company invests in private equity, real estate and other
    assets directly and through funds that the firm raises and
    manages. In connection with these activities, the parent company
    had commitments to invest up to $12.90&#160;billion and
    $6.34&#160;billion as of November 2007 and November 2006,
    respectively, including $12.32&#160;billion and
    $4.39&#160;billion, respectively, of commitments to invest in
    funds managed by the firm.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Construction-Related Commitments.</B>&#160;&#160;As of both
    November 2007 and November 2006, the parent company had
    construction-related commitments of $2&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Leases.</B>&#160;&#160;The parent company has contractual
    obligations under long-term noncancelable lease agreements,
    principally for office space, expiring on various dates through
    2029. Certain agreements are subject to periodic escalation
    provisions for increases in real estate taxes and other charges.
    Future minimum rental payments, net of minimum sublease rentals,
    which are generally reimbursed by subsidiaries, are set forth
    below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 0%">

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">THE GOLDMAN SACHS
    GROUP, INC.<BR>
    (PARENT COMPANY ONLY)<BR>
    <BR>
    NOTES TO CONDENSED NONCONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Contingencies</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Refer to Note&#160;6 to the consolidated financial statements in
    Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for information on contingencies.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Guarantees</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The parent company has guaranteed the payment obligations of
    Goldman, Sachs&#160;&#038; Co., its principal
    U.S.&#160;broker-dealer subsidiary (other than nonrecourse
    payment obligations). In addition, the parent company guarantees
    many of the obligations of its other consolidated subsidiaries
    on a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">transaction-by-transaction</FONT>
    basis, as negotiated with the counterparty. The parent company
    is unable to develop an estimate of the maximum payout under its
    subsidiary guarantees; however, because these guaranteed
    obligations are also obligations of consolidated subsidiaries
    and included in the consolidated statements of financial
    condition or disclosed in Note&#160;6 to the consolidated
    financial statements in Part&#160;II, Item&#160;8 of the Annual
    Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K,</FONT>
    the parent company&#146;s liabilities as guarantor are not
    separately disclosed herein.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following tables set forth certain information about the
    parent company&#146;s guarantees as of November 2007 and
    November 2006:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 0%">

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<A name='139'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">POWER OF
    ATTORNEY</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    KNOW ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that each person whose
    signature appears below constitutes and appoints Lloyd C.
    Blankfein, Gary D. Cohn, Jon Winkelried, David A. Viniar,
    Gregory K. Palm and Esta E. Stecher, and each of them severally,
    his or her true and lawful attorney-in-fact with power of
    substitution and resubstitution to sign in his or her name,
    place and stead, in any and all capacities, to do any and all
    things and execute any and all instruments that such attorney
    may deem necessary or advisable under the Securities Exchange
    Act of 1934 and any rules, regulations and requirements of the
    U.S.&#160;Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with
    the Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    and any and all amendments hereto, as fully for all intents and
    purposes as he or she might or could do in person, and hereby
    ratifies and confirms all said attorneys-in-fact and agents,
    each acting alone, and his or her substitute or substitutes, may
    lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 5%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    1934, this report has been signed below by the following persons
    on behalf of the Registrant and in the capacities and on the
    dates indicated.
